description: This is a market group over what terms Karine Jean-Pierre will say during her next White House press briefing.

markets.description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Karine Jean-Pierre says "one more question" during the next White House press briefing she participates in. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

If no such press briefing happens by January 19, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No". If KJP ceases to be White House press secretary for any length of time by January 19, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video and transcripts of the press briefing.
markets.question: Will KJP say "one more question" during next press briefing?

markets.description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Karine Jean-Pierre says "South Korea" during the next White House press briefing she participates in. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "South Korea" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the country in East Asia.

If no such press briefing happens by January 19, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No". If KJP ceases to be White House press secretary for any length of time by January 19, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video and transcripts of the press briefing.
